UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the amino acid sequence of the UniProt entry.

Literature.Title: New caerin antibiotic peptides from the skin secretion of the Dainty Green Tree Frog Litoria gracilenta. Identification using positive and negative ion electrospray mass spectrometry.
Literature.Author: Maclean MJ, Brinkworth CS, Bilusich D, Bowie JH, Doyle JR, Llewellyn LE, Tyler MJ

Literature.Title: Inhibition of HIV Infection by Caerin 1 Antimicrobial Peptides
Literature.Author: VanCompernolle SE, Smith PB, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Unutmaz D, Rollins-Smith LA

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Bacillus cereus(MIC=50µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis(MIC=>100µg/ml),Leuconostoc lactis(MIC=3µg/ml),Listeria innocua(MIC=12µg/ml),Micrococcus luteus(MIC=25µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=12µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MIC=12µg/ml),Staphylococcus epidermidis(MIC=12µg/ml),Streptococcus uberis(MIC=25µg/ml),Enterobacter cloacae(MIC=>100µg/ml),Escherichia coli(MIC=>100µg/ml),Pasteurella multocida(MIC=50µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=>100µg/ml),HIV PsV(IC50 I=2.5µM)
